comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is likely the General Jose Leyva, military commandant from the Villa regime at Guaymas, Sonora, Mexico, who was involved in communications with the U.S. Navy over its intention to land troops to protect American settlers in the Yaqui Valley from "marauding Yaqui Indians" in late June, 1915. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0F17FD3B5C1373... select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0E16F73A5C1373...
